text:
Do not remember the former things
    nor consider the things of old.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, I will do a new thing,
    now it shall spring forth; shall you not be aware of it?
I will even make a way in the wilderness,
    and rivers in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The beast of the field shall honor Me,
    the jackals and the owls,
because I give waters in the wilderness,
    and rivers in the desert,
to give drink to My people, My chosen ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This people I have formed for Myself;
    they shall declare My praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you have not called upon Me, O Jacob;
    but you have been weary of Me, O Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have not brought Me the sheep for your burnt offerings,
    nor have you honored Me with your sacrifices.
I have not burdened you with offerings,
    nor wearied you with incense.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I, even I, am He who blots out
    your transgressions for My own sake,
    and will not remember your sins.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Your first father has sinned,
    and your teachers have transgressed against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, I have profaned the princes of the sanctuary,
    and have given Jacob to the curse,
    and Israel to reproaches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet now listen, O Jacob, My servant,
    and Israel, whom I have chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord
    who made you, and formed you from the womb,
    who will help you:
Do not fear, O Jacob, My servant, and you,
    Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
and they shall spring up as among the grass,
    as willows by the water courses.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord the King of Israel,
    and his Redeemer the Lord of Hosts:
I am the first, and I am the last;
    besides Me there is no God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is like Me? Let him proclaim
    and declare it, and recount it in order for Me,
since I appointed the ancient people.
    And let them declare to them the things that are coming,
    and shall come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not fear, nor be afraid;
    have I not told you from of old, and declared it?
    You are My witnesses!
Is there a God besides Me?
    There is no Rock; I know not any.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who has formed a god or molded a graven image
    that is profitable for nothing?
speaker: Narrator

text:
All his companions shall be ashamed;
    and the workmen, they are mere men.
Let them all be gathered together; let them stand up,
    yet they shall fear; they shall be ashamed together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The smith with the tongs
    both works in the coals
and fashions it with hammers,
    and works it with the strength of his arms.
He becomes hungry, and his strength fails;
    He drinks no water and is faint.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The carpenter stretches out his measuring line;
    he marks it out with a line;
he fits it with planes,
    and he marks it out with the compass,
and makes it after the figure of a man,
    according to the beauty of a man,
    that it may remain in the house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He hews down cedars for himself,
    and takes the cypress and the oak,
which he raises for himself among the trees of the forest.
    He plants a fir, and the rain makes it grow.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
And the rest he makes into a god, even his carved image.
    He falls down to it, and worships it,
and prays to it, and says,
    “Deliver me, for you are my god.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
He feeds on ashes; a deceived heart has turned him aside
    so that he cannot deliver his soul, nor say,
    “Is there not a lie in my right hand?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I have blotted out, as a thick cloud,
    your transgressions, and your sins, as a cloud.
Return to Me,
    for I have redeemed you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing, O heavens, for the Lord has done it.
    Shout joyfully, you lower parts of the earth;
break forth into singing, you mountains,
    O forest, and every tree in it.
For the Lord has redeemed Jacob,
    and glorified Himself in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord,
    your Redeemer, and He who formed you from the womb: 
I am the Lord
    who makes all things,
    who stretches out the heavens alone,
    who spreads abroad the earth by Myself,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who frustrates the omens of the boasters
    and makes fools out of diviners,
who turns wise men backward
    and makes their knowledge foolish,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who confirms the word of His servant
    and performs the counsel of His messengers, 
who says to Jerusalem, “You shall be inhabited,”
    and to the cities of Judah, “You shall be built.”
    And I will raise up her ruins again;
speaker: Narrator

text:
it is I who says to the deep, “Be dried up!”
    And I will dry up your rivers;
speaker: Narrator

text:
it is I who says of Cyrus, “He is My shepherd,
    and shall perform all My desire”;
    and he declares to Jerusalem, “You shall be built,”
    and to the temple, “Your foundation shall be laid.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord to Cyrus, His anointed,
    whose right hand I have held—
to subdue nations before him
    and to loosen the loins of kings,
to open doors before him
    so that the gates will not be shut:
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will go before you
    and make the crooked places straight;
I will break in pieces the gates of bronze
    and shatter the bars of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will give you the treasures of darkness
    and hidden riches of secret places
so that you may know that I, the Lord,
    who calls you by your name, am the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Jacob My servant’s sake
    and Israel My chosen one,
I have even called you by your name;
    I have named you,
    though you have not known Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am the Lord and there is no other;
    there is no God besides Me.
I strengthen you,
    though you have not known Me,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that they may know from the rising of the sun
    and from the west
that there is no one besides Me.
    I am the Lord, and there is no other;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Woe to him who strives with his Maker,
    the potsherd with the potsherds of the earth!
Shall the clay say to the potter,
    “What are you making?”
Or the thing you are making say,
    “He has no hands”?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to him who says to his father,
    “What are you begetting?”
Or to the woman,
    “To what are you giving birth?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord,
    the Holy One of Israel and his Maker:
Ask Me of things to come
    concerning My sons,
    and you shall commit to Me the work of My hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have made the earth
    and created man on it.
I, even My hands, have stretched out the heavens,
    and I have ordained all their host.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have raised him up in righteousness,
    and I will direct all his ways;
he shall build My city,
    and he shall let My captives go,
neither for price nor reward,
    says the Lord of Hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
The products of Egypt and merchandise of Ethiopia
    and of the Sabeans—men of stature—
shall come over to you,
    and they shall be yours;
they shall come after you;
    in chains they shall come over,
and they shall fall down before you.
    They shall make supplication to you, saying,
“Surely God is with you, and there is no other;
    there is no other God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Truly You are a God who hides Yourself,
    O God of Israel, the Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall be ashamed and also humiliated, all of them;
    the craftsmen of idols shall go away in confusion together,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but Israel shall be saved by the Lord
    with an everlasting salvation;
you shall not be ashamed nor humiliated
    to all eternity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord,
who created the heavens,
    who is God,
who formed the earth and made it,
    who has established it,
who did not create it in vain,
    who formed it to be inhabited:
I am the Lord,
    and there is no other.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Assemble yourselves and come;
    draw near together, you fugitives of the nations.
They have no knowledge who set up the wood of their carved image,
    and pray to a god that cannot save.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare and set forth your case;
    let them take counsel together.
Who has declared this from ancient times?
    Who has told it from that time?
Have not I, the Lord?
    And there is no God besides Me,
a righteous God and Savior;
    there is no other besides Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to Me and be saved,
    all the ends of the earth.
    For I am God, and there is no other.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have sworn by Myself,
    the word has gone out of My mouth in righteousness
    and shall not return,
that to Me every knee shall bow,
    every tongue shall take an oath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely, one shall say, “Only in the Lord
    are righteousness and strength.”
Men shall come to him,
    and all who are incensed at Him shall be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the Lord shall all the seed of Israel
    be justified and shall glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bel bows down, Nebo stoops,
    their idols are appointed to the beasts and the cattle.
The things that you carry are burdensome;
    they are a burden to the weary beast.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Listen to Me, O house of Jacob,
    and all the remnant of the house of Israel,
who are borne by Me from birth
    and are carried from the womb:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
To whom will you liken Me, and make Me equal,
    and compare Me that we may be alike?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They lift it on the shoulder, they carry it,
    and they set it in its place, and it stands;
    from its place it does not move.
If one shall cry to it, it cannot answer
    nor save him out of his trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember this, and show yourselves men;
    bring it to mind again, O transgressors.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
declaring the end from the beginning,
    and from ancient times the things that are not yet done, saying,
“My counsel shall stand,
    and I will do all My good pleasure,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
calling a ravenous bird from the east,
    the man who executes My counsel from a far country.
Indeed, I have spoken it; I will also bring it to pass.
    I have purposed it; I will also do it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to Me, you stubborn-hearted,
    who are far from righteousness;
speaker: Narrator

text:
I bring My righteousness near;
    it shall not be far off,
    and My salvation shall not tarry.
And I will grant salvation in Zion,
    and My glory for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come down, and sit in the dust,
    O virgin daughter of Babylon;
sit on the ground; there is no throne,
    O daughter of the Chaldeans.
For you shall no more be called
    tender and delicate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take the millstones and grind meal.
    Uncover your veil,
strip off the skirt, uncover the leg,
    pass over the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your nakedness shall be uncovered,
    and your shame shall be seen;
I will take vengeance,
    and I will not meet you as a man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for our Redeemer, the Lord of Hosts is His name,
    the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sit silently, and go into darkness,
    O daughter of the Chaldeans;
for you shall no more be called
    the queen of kingdoms.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You said, “I shall be a queen forever,”
    but you did not take these things to heart,
    nor remember the outcome of them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
but these two things shall come to you
    in a moment, in one day,
    the loss of children and widowhood.
They shall come upon you in their fullness
    because of the multitude of your sorceries
    and for the great abundance of your enchantments.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore, evil shall come upon you,
    which you shall not know from where it rises.
And disaster shall fall upon you,
    for which you shall not be able to atone.
And desolation shall come upon you suddenly,
    which you shall not know.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Stand fast now with your enchantments,
    and with the multitude of your sorceries
    in which you have labored from your youth.
Perhaps you shall be able to profit,
    perhaps you may cause trembling.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Thus those shall be to you
    with whom you have labored,
    even your merchants, from your youth;
they shall wander, everyone to his quarter.
    No one shall save you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
I have even from the beginning declared it to you;
    before it came to pass I announced it to you,
lest you should say,
    “My idol has done them,
    and my carved image and my molded image has commanded them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have heard; see all this.
    And will you not declare it? 
I have shown you new things from this time,
    even hidden things, and you did not know them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are created now and not from the beginning;
    even before the day when you did not hear them,
lest you should say,
    “Yes, I knew them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have not heard, you have not known,
    indeed, from long ago your ear has not been open.
For I knew that you would deal very treacherously,
    and that from birth you have been called a rebel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For My name’s sake I will defer My anger,
    and for My praise I will restrain it for you
    so that you are not cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, I have refined you, but not with silver;
    I have chosen you in the furnace of affliction.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Listen to Me, O Jacob
    and Israel, whom I called:
I am He;
    I am the First, and I am the Last.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My hand also has laid the foundation of the earth,
    and My right hand has spanned the heavens;
when I call to them,
    they stand up together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Assemble, all of you, and listen.
    Who among them has declared these things?
The Lord has loved him;
    he will do His pleasure on Babylon,
    and His arm shall be against the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I, even I, have spoken,
    and I have called him;
I have brought him,
    and his way will prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come near to Me, hear this:
I have not spoken in secret from the beginning;
    from the time that it was, there I am. 
And now the Lord God has sent me
    and His Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord,
    your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel:
I am the Lord your God,
    who teaches you to profit,
    who leads you in the way you should go.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, that you had listened to My commandments!
    Then your peace would have been as a river
    and your righteousness as the waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your descendants also would have been as the sand
    and your offspring like grains of sand;
their name would not have been cut off
    nor destroyed from before Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go forth from Babylon!
    Flee from the Chaldeans!
With a voice of singing declare,
    proclaim this,
utter it even to the ends of the earth;
    say, “The Lord has redeemed His servant Jacob.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: “There is no peace,” says the Lord, “for the wicked.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to me, O coastlands,
    and pay attention, you peoples from afar.
The Lord called me from the womb;
    from the body of my mother He named me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He said to me, “You are My servant,
    Israel, in whom I will be glorified.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I said, “I have labored in vain;
    I have spent my strength for nothing and vanity,
yet surely the justice due to me is with the Lord,
    and my reward with my God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now says the Lord,
    who formed me from the womb to be His servant,
to bring Jacob back to Him,
    so that Israel might be gathered to Him
(yet I am honored in the eyes of the Lord,
    and my God is my strength),
speaker: Narrator

text:
He says,
“It is a light thing that you should be My servant
    to raise up the tribes of Jacob
    and to restore the preserved ones of Israel;
I will also make you a light to the nations
    so that My salvation may reach to the ends of the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord,
    the Redeemer of Israel, and his Holy One,
to the despised one, to the one whom the nation abhors,
    to the servant of rulers:
“Kings shall see and arise,
    princes also shall worship,
because of the Lord who is faithful
    and the Holy One of Israel who has chosen you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
In an acceptable time I have heard you,
    and in a day of salvation I have helped you;
and I will preserve you, and give you
    as a covenant of the people,
to restore the earth,
    to make them inherit the desolate heritages,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying to the prisoners, “Go forth,”
    to those who are in darkness, “Show yourselves.” 
They shall feed along the paths,
    and their pastures shall be in all desolate heights;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will make all My mountains a road,
    and My highways shall be raised up.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Sing, O heavens!
    And be joyful, O earth!
    And break forth into singing, O mountains!
For the Lord has comforted His people
    and will have mercy on His afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Zion said, “The Lord has forsaken me,
    and the Lord has forgotten me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can a woman forget her nursing child,
    and have no compassion on the son of her womb?
Even these may forget,
    yet I will not forget.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, I have inscribed you on the palms of My hands;
    your walls are continually before Me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
your builders hurry;
    your destroyers and those who devastated you shall depart from you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your eyes and look all around;
    all these gather themselves together and come to you.
As I live, says the Lord,
    you shall surely put on all of them as ornaments
    and bind them on you as a bride does.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your waste and your desolate places,
    and the land of your destruction,
shall even now be too narrow by reason of the inhabitants,
    and those who swallowed you up shall be far away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children whom you shall have,
    after you have lost the others,
shall say again in your ears,
    “The place is too cramped for me;
    make room for me that I may dwell here.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you shall say in your heart,
    “Who bore these for me,
since I have lost my children and am barren,
    a captive and a wanderer?
    And who has brought these up?
I was left alone;
    from where did these come?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
kings shall be your foster fathers
    and their queens your nursing mothers;
they shall bow down to you with their faces toward the ground
    and lick up the dust of your feet.
And you shall know that I am the Lord,
    for those who wait for Me shall not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can the prey be taken from the mighty
    or the captives of a tyrant be delivered?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will feed those who oppress you with their own flesh,
    and they shall be drunk with their own blood as with sweet wine.
And all flesh shall know
    that I, the Lord, am your Savior
    and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
Where is the certificate of divorce
    by which I sent your mother away?
Or to which of My creditors
    did I sell you?
For your iniquities you were sold,
    and for your transgressions your mother was sent away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why, when I came, was there no man?
    When I called, was there no one to answer?
Is My hand so short that it cannot redeem?
    Or have I no power to deliver?
Indeed, at My rebuke I dry up the sea,
    I make the rivers a wilderness;
Their fish stink because there is no water,
    and die for thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I clothe the heavens with blackness,
    and I make sackcloth their covering.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord God has opened my ear,
    and I was not rebellious,
    nor did I turn back.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I gave my back to those who struck me,
    and my cheeks to those who plucked out my beard;
I did not cover my face
    from shame and spitting.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He who vindicates me is near;
    who will contend with me?
    Let us stand up to each other.
Who is my adversary?
    Let him come near to me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who among you fears the Lord,
    who obeys the voice of His servant,
who walks in darkness
    and has no light?
Let him trust in the name of the Lord,
    and rely upon his God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But now, all you who kindle a fire,
    who encompass yourselves with sparks:
Walk in the light of your fire
    and among the sparks that you have ignited.
This you shall have from My hand:
    You shall lie down in sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to Me, you who pursue righteousness,
    you who seek the Lord:
Look to the rock from which you were hewn
    and to the quarry from which you were dug.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
My righteousness is near,
    My salvation has gone forth,
    and My arms shall judge the peoples;
the coastlands shall wait for Me,
    and for My arm they shall expectantly wait.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your eyes to the heavens,
    and look on the earth beneath.
For the heavens shall vanish away like smoke,
    and the earth shall grow old like a garment,
    and those who dwell in it shall die in like manner;
but My salvation shall be forever,
    and My righteousness shall not be abolished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to Me, you who know righteousness,
    the people in whose heart is My law;
do not fear the reproach of men
    nor be afraid of their revilings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the moth shall eat them up like a garment,
    and the worm shall eat them like wool;
but My righteousness shall be forever
    and My salvation from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake, awake, put on strength,
    O arm of the Lord.
Awake as in the ancient days,
    in the generations of old.
Was it not You who cut Rahab to pieces
    and wounded the dragon?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Was it not You who dried up the sea,
    the waters of the great deep,
who made the depths of the sea a pathway
    for the ransomed to pass over?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, the redeemed of the Lord shall return
    and come with singing to Zion,
    and everlasting joy shall be upon their head.
They shall obtain gladness and joy,
    and sorrow and mourning shall flee away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I, even I, am He who comforts you.
    Who are you that you should be afraid of a man who shall die,
    and of the son of man who shall be made as grass,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and forget the Lord your maker
    who has stretched out the heavens
    and laid the foundations of the earth?
And have feared continually every day
    because of the fury of the oppressor
    as he makes ready to destroy?
Yet where is the fury of the oppressor?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The exile shall soon be freed,
and shall not die in the dungeon,
    nor will his bread be lacking.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I have put My words in your mouth,
    and I have covered you in the shadow of My hand
that I may plant the heavens,
    and lay the foundations of the earth,
    and say to Zion, “You are My people.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake, awake,
    stand up, O Jerusalem,
you who have drunk at the hand of the Lord
    the cup of His fury;
the cup of reeling
    you have drained to the dregs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no one to guide her
    among all the sons she has brought forth;
nor is there anyone to take hold of her hand
    of all the sons that she has brought up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These two things have befallen you;
    who shall be mournful for you?
Desolation, and destruction, and famine, and sword—
    how shall I comfort you?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore please hear this,
    you afflicted who are drunk but not with wine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says your Lord, the Lord,
    and your God who pleads the cause of His people:
See, I have taken out of your hand
    the cup of reeling,
even the dregs of the cup of My fury;
    you will never drink it again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will put it into the hand of those who afflict you,
    who have said to you,
    “Lie down that we may walk over you.”
And you have laid your back as the ground
    and as the street for those who walk on it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake, awake!
    Put on your strength, O Zion;
put on your beautiful garments,
    O Jerusalem, the holy city.
For the uncircumcised and the unclean
    will no longer enter you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shake yourself from the dust;
    arise, O captive Jerusalem.
Loose yourself from the bonds of your neck,
    O captive daughter of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord:
You were sold for nothing,
    and you shall be redeemed without money.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Now therefore, what do I have here, says the Lord,
seeing that My people have been taken away for nothing?
    Those who rule over them make them wail,
    says the Lord,
and My name is continually blasphemed
    all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, My people shall know My name;
    therefore, they shall know in that day
that I am He who does speak:
    Here I am.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How beautiful upon the mountains
    are the feet of him who brings good news,
who proclaims peace,
    who brings good news of happiness,
    who proclaims salvation,
who says to Zion,
    “Your God reigns!”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Break forth into joy, sing together,
    you waste places of Jerusalem.
For the Lord has comforted His people;
    He has redeemed Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has bared His holy arm
    in the eyes of all the nations,
and all the ends of the earth shall see
    the salvation of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart, depart, go out from there,
    touch no unclean thing;
go out of the midst of her; be clean,
    you who bear the vessels of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you shall not go out with haste
    nor go by flight.
For the Lord will go before you,
    and the God of Israel will be your rear guard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, My servant shall deal prudently;
    he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who has believed our report?
    And to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he grew up before Him as a tender plant
    and as a root out of a dry ground.
He has no form or majesty that we should look upon him
    nor appearance that we should desire him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He was despised and rejected of men,
    a man of sorrows and acquainted with grief.
And we hid, as it were, our faces from him;
    he was despised, and we did not esteem him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely he has borne our grief
    and carried our sorrows;
Yet we esteemed him stricken,
    smitten of God, and afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he was wounded for our transgressions,
    he was bruised for our iniquities;
the chastisement of our peace was upon him,
    and by his stripes we are healed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All of us like sheep have gone astray;
    each of us has turned to his own way,
but the Lord has laid on him
    the iniquity of us all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He was oppressed, and he was afflicted,
    yet he opened not his mouth;
he was brought as a lamb to the slaughter,
    and as a sheep before its shearers is silent,
    so he opened not his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By oppression and judgment he was taken away,
    and who shall declare his generation?
For he was cut off out of the land of the living;
    for the transgression of my people he was struck.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His grave was assigned with the wicked,
    yet with the rich in his death,
because he had done no violence,
    nor was any deceit in his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet it pleased the Lord to bruise him; He has put him to grief.
    If he made himself as an offering for sin,
he shall see his offspring, he shall prolong his days,
    and the good pleasure of the Lord shall prosper in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shall see of the anguish of his soul
    and be satisfied.
By his knowledge My righteous servant shall justify the many,
    for he shall bear their iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, I will divide him a portion with the great,
    and he shall divide the spoil with the strong,
because he poured out his soul to death,
    and he was numbered with the transgressors,
thus he bore the sin of many
    and made intercession for the transgressors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing, O barren,
    you who did not bear a child.
Break forth into singing and cry aloud,
    you who did not travail with child.
For more are the children of the desolate
    than the children of the married wife,
    says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Enlarge the place of your tent,
    and let them stretch out the curtains of your habitations;
    spare not,
lengthen your cords,
    and strengthen your stakes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you shall spread out to the right hand and to the left,
    and your descendants shall inherit the nations
    and make the desolate cities to be inhabited.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the Lord has called you
    as a woman forsaken and grieved in spirit,
and a wife of youth
    when you were refused, says your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a small moment I have forsaken you,
    but with great mercies I will gather you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In a little wrath
    I hid My face from you for a moment;
but with everlasting kindness
    I will have mercy on you,
    says the Lord your Redeemer.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the mountains may be removed,
    and the hills may shake,
but My kindness shall not depart from you,
    nor shall My covenant of peace be removed,
    says the Lord who has mercy on you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O afflicted one, tossed with tempest and not comforted,
    I will lay your stones with fair colors
    and lay your foundations with sapphires.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make your windows of agates,
    and your gates of crystal,
    and all your borders of precious stones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All your sons shall be taught of the Lord,
    and great shall be the peace of your sons.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Indeed they shall surely assail you fiercely, but not from Me.
    Whoever assails you shall fall for your sake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, I have created the smith
    that blows the coals in the fire
    and who brings forth an instrument for his work;
and I have created the destroyer in order to cause ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No weapon that is formed against you shall prosper,
    and every tongue that shall rise against you in judgment, you shall condemn.
This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord,
    and their vindication is from Me,
    says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ho! Everyone who thirsts,
    come to the waters;
and you who have no money,
    come, buy and eat.
Come, buy wine and milk
    without money and without price.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you spend money for that which is not bread,
    and your labor for that which does not satisfy?
Listen diligently to Me, and eat what is good,
    and let your soul delight itself in abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Incline your ear, and come to Me.
    Listen, so that your soul may live,
and I will make an everlasting covenant with you,
    even the sure mercies of David.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, I have given him as a witness to the people,
    a leader and commander to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely you shall call a nation that you do not know,
    and nations that did not know you shall run to you
because of the Lord your God,
    even the Holy One of Israel;
    for He has glorified you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord while He may be found,
    call you upon Him while He is near.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the wicked forsake his way,
    and the unrighteous man his thoughts;
and let him return to the Lord, and He will have mercy upon him,
    and to our God, for He will abundantly pardon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For My thoughts are not your thoughts,
    nor are your ways My ways,
    says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For as the heavens are higher than the earth,
    so are My ways higher than your ways,
    and My thoughts than your thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For as the rain comes down,
    and the snow from heaven,
and do not return there
    but water the earth
and make it bring forth and bud
    that it may give seed to the sower and bread to the eater,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so shall My word be that goes forth from My mouth;
    it shall not return to Me void,
but it shall accomplish that which I please,
    and it shall prosper in the thing for which I sent it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For you shall go out with joy,
    and be led out with peace;
the mountains and the hills
    shall break forth into singing before you,
and all the trees of the field
    shall clap their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead of the thorn shall come up the fir tree,
    and instead of the brier shall come up the myrtle tree;
and it shall be to the Lord for a memorial,
    for an everlasting sign
    that shall not be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
Preserve justice
    and do righteousness,
for My salvation is about to come
    and My righteousness to be revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the man who does this,
    and the son of man who takes hold of it,
who keeps from polluting the Sabbath
    and keeps his hand from doing any evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not let the son of the foreigner
    who has joined himself to the Lord
speak, saying,
    “The Lord has utterly separated me from His people”;
do not let the eunuch say,
    “I am only a dry tree.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord:
To the eunuchs who keep My Sabbaths,
    and choose the things that please Me,
    and take hold of My covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to them I will give in My house and within My walls
    a memorial, and a name
    better than that of sons and of daughters;
I will give them an everlasting name
    that shall not be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also the sons of the foreigner who join themselves to the Lord
    to serve Him,
and to love the name of the Lord,
    and to be His servants,
to everyone who keeps from polluting the Sabbath
    and takes hold of My covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
even them I will bring to My holy mountain
    and make them joyful in My house of prayer.
Their burnt offerings and their sacrifices
    shall be accepted on My altar;
for My house shall be called
    a house of prayer for all people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord God
    who gathers the outcasts of Israel says,
Yet I will gather others to them
    besides those who already are gathered to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All you beasts of the field,
    all you beasts in the forest, come to devour.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They are greedy dogs
    which can never have enough,
and they are shepherds who cannot understand;
    they all turn to their own way,
    every one for his gain, from his territory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Come,” they say, “let us get wine,
    and let us fill ourselves with strong drink;
and tomorrow shall be as today,
    only more so.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
But draw near to here, you sons of a sorceress,
    offspring of an adulterer and prostitute.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whom do you mock?
    Against whom do you open wide your mouth
    and stick out your tongue?
Are you not children of transgression,
    offspring of falsehood,
speaker: Narrator

text:
inflaming yourselves with idols
    under every green tree,
slaying the children in the valleys
    under the clefts of the rocks?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
On a lofty and high mountain you have set your bed;
    even there you went up to offer sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You went to the king with ointment,
    and increased your perfumes,
and sent your messengers far off,
    and made them go down to Sheol.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Of whom were you afraid or fearful
    when you lied
and you did not remember Me,
    nor give Me a thought?
Have I not held My peace for a long time
    so that you do not fear Me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will declare your righteousness, and your works,
    yet they shall not profit you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you cry out,
    let your collection of idols deliver you.
But the wind shall carry them all away,
    a breath shall take them away.
But he who puts his trust in Me
    shall possess the land
    and shall inherit My holy mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it shall be said,
“Build up, build up, prepare the way,
    take up every stumbling block out of the way of My people.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the High and Lofty One
    who inhabits eternity, whose name is Holy:
I dwell in the high and holy place
    and also with him who is of a contrite and humble spirit,
to revive the spirit of the humble,
    and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
I have seen his ways but will heal him;
    I will lead him and restore comfort to him and to his mourners,
speaker: Narrator

text:
by creating the fruit of the lips.
Peace, peace to him who is far off and to him who is near,
    says the Lord, and I will heal him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the wicked are like the troubled
    sea when it cannot rest,
    whose waters cast up mire and dirt.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no peace, says my God, for the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cry aloud, do not hold back;
    lift up your voice like a trumpet,
and show My people their transgression
    and the house of Jacob their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet they seek Me daily
    and delight to know My ways,
as a nation that has done righteousness
    and has not forsaken the ordinance of their God.
They ask Me for the ordinances of justice;
    they take delight in approaching God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Why have we fasted
    and You do not see?
Why have we humbled ourselves
    and You take no notice?” 
Certainly, on the day of your fast you find your desire
    and are exacting on all your laborers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Certainly, you fast for strife and debate
    and to strike with the fist of wickedness.
You do not fast as you do this day,
    to make your voice to be heard on high.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is it such a fast that I have chosen,
    a day for a man to humble himself?
Is it to bow down his head as a bulrush,
    and to spread out sackcloth and ashes under him?
Will you call this a fast
    and an acceptable day to the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is not this the fast that I have chosen:
to loose the bonds of wickedness,
    to undo the heavy burdens,
and to let the oppressed go free,
    and break every yoke?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is it not to divide your bread with the hungry
    and bring the poor who are outcasts into your house?
When you see the naked, to cover him
    and not hide yourself from your own flesh?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then your light shall break forth as the morning,
    and your healing shall spring forth quickly,
and your righteousness shall go before you;
    the glory of the Lord shall be your reward.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you shall call, and the Lord shall answer;
    you shall cry, and He shall say, Here I am. 
If you take away the yoke from your midst,
    the pointing of the finger, and speaking wickedness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and if you give yourself to the hungry
    and satisfy the afflicted soul,
then your light shall rise in obscurity,
    and your darkness shall become as the noonday.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the Lord shall guide you continually,
    and satisfy your soul in drought,
    and strengthen your bones;
and you shall be like a watered garden,
    and like a spring of water, whose waters do not fail.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
If because of the Sabbath you turn away your foot
    from doing your pleasure on My holy day,
and call the Sabbath a delight,
    the holy day of the Lord honorable,
and honor it, not doing your own ways,
    nor finding your own pleasure, nor speaking your own words,
speaker: Narrator

text:
then you shall delight yourself in the Lord,
    and I will cause you to ride upon the high places of the earth,
    and feed you with the heritage of Jacob your father.
    For the mouth of the Lord has spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Certainly, the hand of the Lord is not so short that it cannot save,
    nor is His ear so dull that it cannot hear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But your iniquities have made a separation between
    you and your God,
and your sins have hidden His face from you
    so that He will not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your hands are defiled with blood
    and your fingers with iniquity;
your lips have spoken lies,
    your tongue has muttered perverseness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No one calls for justice,
    nor does anyone plead for truth.
They trust in vanity and speak lies;
    they conceive mischief and bring forth iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They hatch adders’ eggs
    and weave the spider’s web;
he who eats of their eggs dies,
    and that which is crushed breaks out into a viper.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their webs shall not become garments,
    nor shall they cover themselves with their works;
their works are works of iniquity,
    and an act of violence is in their hands.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore, justice is far from us,
    nor does righteousness overtake us;
we wait for light, but there is darkness,
    for brightness, but we walk in gloom.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
For our transgressions are multiplied before You,
    and our sins testify against us;
for our transgressions are with us.
    And as for our iniquities, we know them:
speaker: Narrator

text:
transgressing, and lying against the Lord,
    and departing away from our God,
speaking oppression and revolt,
    conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Truth is lacking,
    and he who departs from evil makes himself a prey.
Then the Lord saw it, and it displeased Him
    that there was no justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He saw that there was no man
    and was astonished that there was no intercessor;
therefore, His own arm brought salvation to Him,
    and His righteousness sustained Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He put on righteousness as a breastplate
    and a helmet of salvation on His head;
He put on the garments of vengeance for clothing
    and was clad with zeal as a cloak.
speaker: Narrator

text:
According to their deeds,
    accordingly He will repay:
fury to His adversaries,
    recompense to His enemies;
    to the islands He will make recompense.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So shall they fear the name of the Lord from the west
    and His glory from the rising of the sun;
when the enemy shall come in like a flood,
    the Spirit of the Lord shall lift up a standard against him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Redeemer shall come to Zion
    and to those who turn from transgression in Jacob,
    says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for Me, this is My covenant with them, says the Lord: My Spirit who is upon you, and My words which I have put in your mouth shall not depart out of your mouth, nor out of the mouth of your descendants, nor out of the mouth of your descendants’ descendants, says the Lord, from this time forth and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, shine, for your light has come,
    and the glory of the Lord has risen upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the darkness shall cover the earth
    and deep darkness the peoples;
but the Lord shall rise upon you,
    and His glory shall be seen upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations shall come to your light
    and kings to the brightness of your rising.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your eyes all around, and see:
    They all gather themselves together; they come to you;
your sons shall come from afar,
    and your daughters shall be carried at your side.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you shall see and be radiant,
    and your heart shall thrill and rejoice
because the abundance of the sea shall be converted to you,
    the wealth of the nations shall come to you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered together to you,
    the rams of Nebaioth shall minister to you;
they shall come up with acceptance on My altar,
    and I will glorify My glorious house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who are these who fly as a cloud
    and as the doves to their roosts?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely the coastlands shall wait for Me,
    and the ships of Tarshish shall come first,
to bring your sons from afar,
    their silver and their gold with them,
to the name of the Lord your God
    and to the Holy One of Israel
    because He has glorified you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore, your gates shall be open continually;
    they shall not be shut day nor night,
so that men may bring to you the wealth of the nations,
    and that their kings may be brought.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the nation and kingdom that will not serve you shall perish,
    and those nations shall be utterly destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The glory of Lebanon shall come to you,
    the fir tree, the pine tree, and the box tree together,
to beautify the place of My sanctuary;
    and I will make the place of My feet glorious.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons also of those who afflicted you shall come bowing before you,
    and all those who despised you shall bow themselves down at the soles of your feet;
and they shall call you, The City of the Lord,
    the Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whereas you have been forsaken
    and hated so that no man went through you,
I will make you an eternal excellency,
    a joy of many generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall also suck the milk of the nations
    and suck the breast of kings;
then you shall know that I, the Lord, am your Savior
    and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Violence shall no more be heard in your land,
    nor devastation or destruction within your borders;
but you shall call your walls Salvation
    and your gates Praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun shall no longer be your light by day,
    nor for brightness shall the moon give light to you;
but the Lord shall be an everlasting light to you
    and your God for your glory.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then all your people shall be righteous;
    they shall inherit the land forever,
the branch of My planting,
    the work of My hands,
    that I may be glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A little one shall become a thousand,
    and a small one a strong nation.
I, the Lord,
    will hasten it in its time.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
They shall build the old ruins;
    they shall raise up the former desolations,
and they shall repair the waste cities,
    the desolations of many generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Strangers shall stand and feed your flocks,
    and the sons of the alien shall be your plowmen and your vinedressers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you shall be named the priests of the Lord;
    men shall call you the ministers of our God.
You shall eat the riches of the nations,
    and in their glory you shall boast.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead of your shame
    you shall have double honor,
and instead of humiliation
    they shall rejoice over their portion.
Therefore, in their land they shall possess a double portion;
    everlasting joy shall be theirs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I, the Lord, love justice,
    I hate robbery in the burnt offering;
and I will faithfully give them their recompense
    and make an everlasting covenant with them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their descendants shall be known among the nations
    and their offspring among the peoples.
All who see them shall acknowledge them
    because they are the descendants whom the Lord has blessed.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For as the earth brings forth her buds,
    and as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth,
so the Lord God will cause righteousness and praise
    to spring forth before all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of Zion I will not keep silent,
    and for the sake of Jerusalem I will not rest
until her righteousness goes forth as brightness
    and her salvation as a lamp that burns.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations shall see your righteousness,
    and all kings your glory.
And you shall be called by a new name,
    which the mouth of the Lord shall name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall also be a crown of glory in the hand of the Lord
    and a royal diadem in the hand of your God.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For as a young man marries a virgin,
    so your sons shall marry you;
and as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride,
    so your God shall rejoice over you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have set watchmen on your walls, O Jerusalem,
    who shall never hold their peace day nor night.
You who remind the Lord,
    do not keep silent;
speaker: Narrator

text:
give Him no rest until He establishes
    and makes Jerusalem a glory in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has sworn by His right hand
    and by His strong arm:
Surely I will no longer give your grain
    as food for your enemies;
and the sons of the foreigners shall not drink your wine
    for which you have labored.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But those who have gathered it shall eat it
    and praise the Lord;
and those who have brought it shall drink it
    in the courts of My sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord has proclaimed
    to the ends of the earth:
Say to the daughter of Zion,
    “See, your salvation comes;
see, His reward is with Him,
    and His recompense before Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall call them The Holy People,
    the Redeemed of the Lord;
and you shall be called Sought Out,
    a City Not Forsaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Who is this who comes from Edom
    with dyed garments from Bozrah?
This one who is glorious in His apparel,
    traveling in the greatness of His strength?” 
“It is I who speak in righteousness,
    mighty to save.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Why is Your apparel red,
    and Your garments like him who treads in the wine vat?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I have trodden the winepress alone;
    and from the peoples there was no one with Me.
For I will tread them in My anger,
    and trample them in My fury,
and their blood shall be sprinkled upon My garments,
    and I will stain all My raiment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the day of vengeance is in My heart,
    and My year of redemption has come.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will tread down the peoples in My anger
    and make them drunk in My fury,
    and I will pour out their lifeblood on the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will mention the steadfast love of the Lord
    and the praises of the Lord,
    according to all that the Lord has bestowed on us,
and the great goodness toward the house of Israel,
which He has bestowed on them
    according to His mercy,
    and according to the multitude of His kindnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He said, “Surely they are My people,
    sons who will not lie.”
    So He became their Savior.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But they rebelled
    and grieved His Holy Spirit;
therefore, He turned Himself to be their enemy,
    and He fought against them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then His people remembered the days of old,
    of Moses, saying:
Where is He who brought them up out of the sea
    with the shepherds of His flock?
Where is He who put
    His Holy Spirit in their midst,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who led them with His glorious arm
    by the right hand of Moses,
dividing the water before them,
    to make Himself an everlasting name,
speaker: Narrator

text:
who led them through the deep,
as a horse in the wilderness,
    that they should not stumble?
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the cattle which go down into the valley,
    the Spirit of the Lord caused them to rest,
so You led Your people,
    to make Yourself a glorious name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look down from heaven and see,
    from Your holy and glorious habitation.
Where are Your zeal and Your strength?
    The stirrings of Your heart and Your mercies toward me are restrained.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You are our Father,
    though Abraham is ignorant of us
    and Israel does not recognize us.
You, O Lord, are our Father, our Redeemer;
    Your name is from everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, why have You made us to err from Your ways
    and hardened our heart from fearing You?
Return for Your servants’ sake,
    the tribes of Your inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your holy people possessed Your sanctuary for a little while;
    our adversaries have trodden it down.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have become
    as those over whom You have never ruled,
    as those who were not called by Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, that You would rend the heavens and come down,
    that the mountains might shake at Your presence,
speaker: Narrator

text:
as when the melting fire burns,
    as the fire causes the waters to boil,
to make Your name known to Your adversaries,
    that the nations may tremble at Your presence!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When You did awesome things for which we did not look,
    You came down; the mountains quaked at Your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For since the beginning of the world men have not heard,
    nor perceived by ear,
neither has the eye seen a God besides You,
    who acts for the one who waits for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You meet him who rejoices in doing righteousness,
    those who remember You in Your ways.
Indeed, You were angry, for we had sinned;
    in our sins we remained a long time,
    and shall we be saved?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But we all are as an unclean thing,
    and all our righteousness is as filthy rags;
and we all fade as a leaf,
    and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no one who calls on Your name,
    who stirs up himself to take hold of You;
for You have hidden Your face from us
    and have consumed us because of our iniquities.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Do not be wrathful beyond measure, O Lord,
    nor remember iniquity forever;
look upon us, we pray,
    we all are Your people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your holy cities are a wilderness;
    Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Will You refrain Yourself from these things, O Lord?
    Will You hold Your peace and afflict us beyond measure?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was sought by those who did not ask for Me;
    I was found of those who did not seek Me.
I said, “Here I am, here I am,”
    to a nation that did not call on My name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have spread out My hands all day
    to a rebellious people
who walk in a way that was not good,
    after their own thoughts;
speaker: Narrator

text:
a people who provoke Me continually
    to My face,
presenting sacrifices in gardens
    and burning incense on altars of brick;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
who say, “Stand by yourself; do not come near to me,
    for I am holier than you!”
These are smoke in My nose,
    a fire that burns all day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
See, it is written before Me:
    I will not keep silent, but I will recompense,
    even recompense into their bosom,
speaker: Narrator

text:
your iniquities and the iniquities of your fathers together,
    says the Lord;
because they have burned incense on the mountains
    and blasphemed Me on the hills,
therefore, I will measure their former work
    into their bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
As the new wine is found in the cluster,
    and one says, “Do not destroy it
    for a blessing is in it,”
so I will do for the sake of My servants
    that I may not destroy them all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bring forth descendants from Jacob,
    and out of Judah an inheritor of My mountains;
and My chosen ones shall inherit it,
    and My servants shall dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sharon shall be a fold of flocks,
    and the Valley of Achor a place for the herds to lie down in,
    for My people who seek Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you are those who forsake the Lord,
    who forget My holy mountain,
who prepare a table for Fortune,
    and who furnish the drink offering for Destiny.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
My servants shall sing for joy
    with a glad heart,
but you shall cry
    with a heavy heart
    and shall wail with grief of spirit.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
For I create
    new heavens and a new earth;
the former things shall not be remembered
    or come to mind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But be glad and rejoice forever
    in that which I create;
for I create Jerusalem for rejoicing
    and her people for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will rejoice in Jerusalem
    and be glad in My people;
and the voice of weeping shall no longer be heard in her,
    nor the voice of crying.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There shall no longer be
    an infant who lives only a few days
    nor an old man who has not filled out his days.
For the child shall die
    a hundred years old,
but the sinner being a hundred years old
    shall be accursed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall build houses and inhabit them;
    and they shall plant vineyards and eat the fruit of them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They shall not labor in vain
    nor bring forth children for trouble;
for they are the descendants of the blessed of the Lord
    and their offspring with them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before they call, I will answer;
    and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wolf and the lamb shall feed together,
    and the lion shall eat straw like the bull,
    and dust shall be the serpent’s food.
They shall not hurt nor destroy
    in all My holy mountain,
    says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
Heaven is My throne,
    and the earth is My footstool.
Where then is the house that you could build for Me?
    And where is the place of My rest?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For My hand made all those things,
    thus all those things have come to be,
    says the Lord. 
But to this man I will look,
    even to him who is poor and of a contrite spirit,
    and trembles at My word.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hear the word of the Lord,
    you who tremble at His word:
Your brothers who hate you,
    who cast you out for My name’s sake, said,
“Let the Lord be glorified
    that we may see your joy.”
    Yet they shall be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A voice of noise from the city,
    a voice from the temple,
the voice of the Lord
    who renders recompense to His enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before she was in labor,
    she gave birth;
before her pain came,
    she delivered a son.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who has heard such a thing?
    Who has seen such things?
Shall the earth be made to give birth in one day?
    Shall a nation be born at once?
For as soon as Zion was in labor,
    she brought forth her sons.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall I bring to the point of birth
    and not cause delivery? says the Lord.
Shall I who cause delivery
    shut the womb? says your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her,
    all you who love her;
rejoice exceedingly with her,
    all you who mourn for her,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that you may feed and be satisfied
    with her consoling breasts,
that you may feed
    and be delighted with the abundance of her bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord:
I will extend peace to her like a river
    and the glory of the nations like a flowing stream.
Then you shall nurse, you shall be carried on her sides,
    and dandled on her knees.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then you shall see this, and your heart shall rejoice,
    and your bones shall flourish like an herb;
and the hand of the Lord shall be known toward His servants,
    and His indignation toward His enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord shall come with fire
    and with His chariots like a whirlwind,
to render His anger with fury
    and His rebuke with flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Those who sanctify themselves and purify themselves in the gardens behind one tree in the midst, eating swine’s flesh, and abominable things, and mice shall be consumed together, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know their works and their thoughts. The time shall come to gather all nations and tongues. And they shall come and see My glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set a sign among them, and send from them survivors to the nations: to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud—who draw the bow—to Tubal, and Javan, to the coastlands afar off who have not heard My fame nor seen My glory. And they shall declare My glory among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall bring all your brothers out of all nations as an offering to the Lord on horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and on mules, and on swift beasts to My holy mountain Jerusalem, says the Lord, as the sons of Israel bring an offering in a clean vessel into the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also take some of them for priests and for Levites, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the new heavens and the new earth which I will make shall remain before Me, says the Lord, so shall your descendants and your name remain.
speaker: Narrator

text: From one New Moon to another, and from one Sabbath to another, all flesh shall come to worship before Me, says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall go forth and look on the corpses of the men who have transgressed against Me. For their worm shall not die, nor shall their fire be quenched. And they shall be an abhorrence to all flesh.
speaker: Narrator
